header.title: ESOTERIC EXTENSION OF TAROT TO DEVELOP SUPERSENSORY POWERS

central_thesis: The 19th Tarot Key, representing the Sun, is a powerful tool for developing supersensory powers and overcoming negative states of consciousness by understanding its symbolic connection to life-giving energy, divine consciousness (Vast Countenance), and the interconnectedness of all existence through Qabalistic principles.

structure_content.summary: This lesson introduces Tarot Key 19, the Sun, as a symbol of life-giving power, image-making consciousness, and the Christ Consciousness. It highlights its potential to overcome depression and despondency when worked with regularly, especially in conjunction with Tarot Key 0 (The Fool). The lesson begins to explore the Qabalistic interpretations of the Hebrew letter Resh and its connection to the 'head' and 'countenance,' linking it to the 'Vast Countenance'â€”the initial emanations from the Absolute in Qabalah. It then draws a parallel between the scientific understanding of the Sun as a mass of hydrogen atoms undergoing nuclear explosions and the human body as a process of combustion and atomic flux, emphasizing that both are living consciousnesses.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Sun's Energetic Role and Consciousness
structure_content.summary: The text elaborates on the Sun as the source of life and energy for Earth, explaining how plants and animals directly or indirectly draw upon solar energy. It posits that everything on Earth, including chemical changes, growth, and motion, is an activity of the Sun. The Sun is presented not as a mechanical entity but as a conscious, intelligent force that determines the life, growth, and evolution of consciousness on the planet. This energy is absorbed and concentrated by living beings and elements, making humans aspects and expressions of the Sun.

Further Qabalistic attributions for the Sun and the letter Resh are explored, including 'Collective Intelligence' and 'Regeneration.' The lesson emphasizes that humans, like the Sun, collect and concentrate energy. Developing this ability leads to greater creativity, joy, and expanded consciousness. The Sun's role in regeneration is highlighted, linking it to physical health and development, with cod liver oil being presented as a secondary source of solar energy. The Egyptian symbolism of the Sun disk with wings is mentioned, reinforcing the idea of the Sun as a conscious, vital deity.

structure_content.chapter_title: Pairs of Opposites and Cosmic Rays
structure_content.summary: The lesson introduces the Qabalistic pair of opposites for Key 19: Fertility and Sterility. It discusses the 'Yods' descending from the Sun in Tarot Key 19 as symbols of waves of light and energy, representing particles from atomic nuclei and cosmic rays. These particles are described as constantly bathing us, forming part of our environment and nourishment, and connecting us to universal life. The text links these particles to the 'touch' of the Divine and to the Hebrew letter Yod's Qabalistic meaning of touch, as seen in Tarot Key 9.

structure_content.chapter_title: Love, Unity, and the Heart Center
structure_content.summary: The number thirteen, associated with the Yods shown in Key 19, is explained as representing love and unity in Hebrew Gematria. This signifies that love and unity shine from the divine source. The lesson then connects the Sun to the chakra corresponding to the cardiac ganglion, or heart center, identifying it as the primary receiving station for solar emanations and the center through which we feel love and compassion. The text emphasizes that knowing this principle in our hearts is crucial.

The lesson concludes by linking the 13th Tarot Key (Death) to fertility and sterility, encouraging the practice of associating symbols from one to another. It stresses that regular study leads to an intuitive understanding, an 'osmosis' of knowledge. The core message is to continue consciously collecting and concentrating solar energies to become an attuned aspect of the Collective Intelligence, expressing full creative beauty and consciousness. This process involves continuous growth and change.

key_concepts.definition: Represents aspects of being such as life-giver, image-making power of consciousness, Beauty, Christ Consciousness, Redeemer, and Savior. Symbolically linked to the sphere of activity at the center of the Tree of Life. It is the source of all energy and consciousness on Earth.

In Qabalah, the very first emanations from behind the Three Negative Veils of the Absolute. It represents a conscious being and is symbolically linked to the head and countenance of humanity, indicating that the physical Sun is a living consciousness.
Means 'head.' Symbolically represents the area above the neck and, by extension, the entire head and countenance. Linked to Key 19, it signifies consciousness and the 'Vast Countenance.'
An attribution of the Sun. It refers to the ability of all beings and elements to collect and concentrate solar energy. Humans are part of this collective intelligence and can develop it consciously.
Another Qabalistic attribution of Resh and the Sun. It refers to the process of renewal and healing driven by solar energy, essential for physical and conscious development.

Components of Hebrew letters, shown in Key 19 as pouring from the Sun. Symbolically represent waves of light and energy, atomic particles, and cosmic rays that emanate from celestial bodies and bathe all existence.
The pair of opposites assigned to Tarot Key 19. These represent fundamental dualities governed by the life-giving and generative forces of the Sun, impacting all aspects of existence.
The chakra assigned to the Sun. It is the primary receiving station for solar emanations and the seat of love, compassion, and consciousness, through which we 'feel' love.

practical_system.description: The practical system presented involves regularly working with Tarot Key 19 (The Sun), in conjunction with Tarot Key 0 (The Fool), with concentration, to overcome despondency and develop supersensory powers. It emphasizes understanding the Sun as a living consciousness and a source of energy. The practice involves consciously collecting and concentrating solar energies, becoming attuned to the Collective Intelligence, and expressing creative beauty. This is achieved through internalizing the concepts of the Sun as the life force, the heart center as a receiver, and the principles of unity, love, and regeneration. The process is described as leading to joy, expanded consciousness, and regeneration.

relevant_quotes.text: This Key, together with Tarot Key 0, the Fool, if worked with regularly and with concentration, will inevitably overcome depression.

The attribution of head tells us in the shorthand language of symbolism that, in actuality, what we see as the physical Sun in our heaven is really a living consciousness, even though to our sensory perceptions it is a physical form which we interpret in another way.
Our physical Sun in the heavens is our life. Let us consider it in terms of this particular planet. Everything that occurs on this planet has its origin in the energy, the life, of the Sun.

We must not, therefore, think of the Sun as a mechanical thing. We must rather learn to see it as this Tarot Key, the Vast Countenance, the life, the spiritual Sun behind what appears as the physical outer form in our immediate environment.
For we are the children of the Sun. Like all on earth, like earth itself, we are aspects of the Sun, expressions of the Sun.
The Sun, therefore, is called the Sun of life and light in the Bible, in the Qabalah and by schools of thought the world over.

These Yods, which are contained in every one of the Hebrew letters, indicate the same thing, physically and symbolically, that the particles of the universe are components of everything that exists, that they are the touch of the Divine.
Thirteen means love and unity in Hebrew Gematria. So, we are given another message: that it is love and unity that shine down from on High, that bathe us, that live us and we them.

The Sun center lies at the cardiac ganglion, or heart, something that most do not realize, although mystics have seen it. In actuality, we all receive emanations from the Sun directly into our heart center.

The important thing is to continue to collect, to become consciously, as you already are subconsciously, an attuned aspect of the Collective Intelligence, so that you can collect and concentrate and express full creative beauty.

critical_analysis.relevance: This text is highly relevant to practitioners of Western Esotericism, particularly those interested in Tarot, Qabalah, and energy work for personal development and the cultivation of psychic abilities. It offers a framework for understanding the Sun not just as a physical entity but as a spiritual and energetic principle vital for consciousness evolution. Its emphasis on the interconnectedness of all life through solar energy provides a foundation for practices involving energy manipulation and a holistic worldview.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is students and practitioners of esoteric arts, particularly those engaged with the teachings of Ann Davies, Qabalah, and Tarot as a system for spiritual and psychic development. It is also relevant for individuals interested in the intersection of science, spirituality, and consciousness, and those seeking to overcome psychological challenges like depression through esoteric means.
